physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Extensive areas of purpuric erosions over the back, buttocks, anterior aspect of the chest, arms, neck, and scalp. The erosions formed a characteristic 'X'-shaped configuration. Oral mucosa, hair, and nails were normal. Ophthalmological examination was normal.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The skin lesions healed with atrophic and hypertrophic scars over the next 3 months with no new vesicular or erosive lesions observed. Alopecia was seen over previously involved scalp areas. At the 15-month review, his growth and development were normal.
